title: Ex-Trump Chief of Staff Mark Meadows Agrees to Speak to Jan. 6 Committee
sub_head: Accommodation comes as Trump’s lawyers argue before federal appeals court that his presidential papers shouldn’t be disclosed to House select committee
body:
WASHINGTON—Former President Donald Trump’s last White House chief of staff agreed to speak to a Democratic-led House committee investigating the Jan. 6 assault on the Capitol Tuesday as a federal appeals court grappled with the novel legal question of whether Mr. Trump could stop disclosure of some of his presidential papers to the committee.
Mark Meadows, who had initially resisted cooperating with the investigation, has produced records to the select committee and will soon appear for an initial deposition, according to a statement by its chairman, Bennie Thompson (D., Miss.). “The committee will continue to assess his degree of compliance with our subpoena after the deposition,” Mr. Thompson said.
